intro: Cyrtandra acmule, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Cyrtandra acmule is adapted to the moist, shaded environments of Hawaiian rainforests.
